name: ListSelfHostedRunnerGroups
description:
Retrieve all self-hosted runner groups for an enterprise.

Fetches a list of all self-hosted runner groups for a specified enterprise. Requires authentication with an access token having the 'manage_runners:enterprise' scope.

parameters.name: enterprise_slug
parameters.description: The slug or ID of the enterprise for which to list self-hosted runner groups. This identifies the enterprise by name or numeric ID.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return per page, up to 100.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: results_page_number
parameters.description: Specifies which page of the self-hosted runner groups results to retrieve. Useful for paginating through large sets of data.

value_schema.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

parameters.name: organization_filter
parameters.description: Filter results to show runner groups usable by the specified organization.

value_schema.description: Only return runner groups that are allowed to be used by this organization.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

value_schema.description: Page number of the results to fetch.

parameters.name: visible_to_organization
parameters.description: Only return runner groups that are allowed to be used by this organization.

value_schema.description: Only return runner groups that are allowed to be used by this organization.

parameters.name: enterprise
parameters.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

value_schema.description: The slug version of the enterprise name. You can also substitute this value with the enterprise id.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
